alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana; Otero (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 12:54PM MST until February 26 at 2:30PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... El Paso County in western Texas... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 1253 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was over West El Paso. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging winds in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement, satellite, and observations. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 158 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 59. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 175 and 176. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 39. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Tornillo, Chaparral, Fabens, Clint, Horizon City, Orogrande, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Hueco Tanks, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, Sunland Park, Indian Cliffs Ranch, Canutillo and San Elizario. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
